teal.sim.spatial

Class SpatialTextLabel

  • java.lang.Object
    • teal.core.AbstractElement
      • teal.render.Rendered
        • teal.sim.SimRendered
          • teal.sim.engine.EngineRendered
            • teal.sim.spatial.Spatial
              • teal.sim.spatial.SpatialTextLabel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, HasID, HasReference, Referenced, TElement, THasPropertyChange, HasBoundingArea, HasColor, HasDirection, HasFog, HasNode3D, HasPosition, HasRotation, IsMoveable, IsPickable, TAbstractRendered, TDrawable, TRendered, HasSimEngine, IsSpatial, TSimElement

    public class SpatialTextLabel
extends Spatial
implements HasReference
    SpatialTextLabel represents a text label, rendered either as a 2D billboard or 3D text (currently just 3D text) that can be attached to another object in the scene, or positioned at a fixed point. The label will retain its position relative to its reference object as described below.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public void render()
        Description copied from interface: TDrawable
        The optimized commands required to update the objects vizualization, this expects the underlying visualization objects have been created and any calculations are complete. It may be restricted to methods that only operate in the rendering thread.

      • makeNode

        public TNode3D makeNode()
        Description copied from class: Rendered
        This method builds the rendered Node3D for this object. It should be overloaded by any sub-class that uses a custom Node3D (in other words, almost all of them).
        Overrides:

      • getPositionOffset

        public javax.vecmath.Vector3d getPositionOffset()
        Returns:
        Returns the positionOffset, which is the offset from the reference object's position that the label will appear.
